message_2:
To factor the polynomial x^3 - 3x^2 + 2x, first look for a common factor among all the terms. In this case, the common factor is x. Factor out x from each term:

x(x^2 - 3x + 2)

Now, we need to factor the quadratic expression inside the parentheses. Look for two numbers that multiply to 2 and add to -3. These numbers are -1 and -2. So, we can rewrite the quadratic expression as:

x((x - 1)(x - 2))

The factored form of the polynomial x^3 - 3x^2 + 2x is:

x(x - 1)(x - 2)
